args:
Given this political fundraising email, respond with the name of the committee in the disclaimer that begins with Paid for by but does not include Paid for by, the committee address or the treasurer name. If no committee is present, return "None". Do not include any other text, no yapping.
name: Pramila Jayapal
email: info@e.pramilaforcongress.com
subject: A moment of light and possibility 🎇
body:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [https://act.pramilaforcongress.com/go/892?refcode=em20241101-4478-footer&t;=1001&akid;=4478%2E420207%2EstGsbt]Pramila Jayapal Peter, This week, South Asians across the world arecelebrating Diwali, a festival that speaks to the deepest hopes of ourcommunity. Also known as the Festival of Lights, it’s a moment ofillumination, of connection, and of profound possibility. And this year, itjust so happens to coincide with an election in which we’ll have the chance toelect the first-ever South Asian as President of the United States. [https://secure.actblue.com/donate/pj-email-20241101-2?refcode=em20241101-4478&refcode2;=4478_420207_stGsbt&akid;=4478%2E420207%2EstGsbt][IMG] On election night in 2016, Kamala Harris and I broke barriers together.I became the first South Asian woman ever elected to the House ofRepresentatives, and she became the first South Asian woman ever elected tothe Senate. Now we stand at the brink of an even more transformative moment.It’s not just a political milestone. It's a testament to the journey ofgenerations of people who have worked, dreamed, and persevered to get us tothis moment. Our community's story is one of resilience — of voices thatrefuse to be dimmed and of traditions that continue to shine brightly acrosscontinents. We see this in the vibrant celebrations happening in homes andcommunities across the nation. In the glow of clay lamps, in the warmth ofshared meals, in the sparkle of joy that connects us. To our diverse SouthAsian community — Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Jains — this is a momentto honor our collective strength. To recognize the challenges we face, thefears that sometimes shadow our experiences, and also the power we have touplift, to support, and to create meaningful change. As we gather with familyand friends, let us recommit ourselves to a future of true belonging. Whereevery voice matters, where every story is heard, where our collective lightcan transform our shared landscape. [ https://secure.actblue.com/donate/pj-email-20241101-2?refcode=em20241101-4478amount=3&refcode2;=4478_420207_stGsbt&akid;=4478%2E420207%2EstGsbt]If you’re with us in the fight to build that future, consider splitting adonation between my campaign and Kamala Harris today. We need your support toget out the vote and elect the first South Asian president on Tuesday. [https://secure.actblue.com/donate/pj-email-20241101-2?amount=3&refcode;=em20241101-4478&refcode2;=4478_420207_stGsbt&akid;=4478%2E420207%2EstGsbt]Contribute From my home to yours, Happy Diwali, Peter. With hope andsolidarity, Pramila Jayapal Contribute to Pramila Jayapal:https://secure.actblue.com/donate/pj-email-footer?refcode=em20241101-4478-footer&t;=1002&refcode2;=4478_420207_stGsbt&akid;=4478%2E420207%2EstGsbtThis email was sent to dpwillis67@gmail.com. Email is the most important wayfor us to reach you about opportunities to get involved. If you need to removeyourself from our email list, click here to unsubscribe: You can unsubscribefrom this mailing list at any time:http://act.pramilaforcongress.com/cms/unsubscribe/unsubscribe/?akid=4478%2E420207%2EstGsbtPaid for by Pramila for Congress.
